articles.title: VAALCO Energy joins ExxonMobil, Chevron offshore West Africa with $66.5 million Svenska Petroleum Exploration acquisition
articles.summary: VAALCO Energy, Inc. has acquired Svenska Petroleum Exploration AB for $66.5 million, gaining a 27.39% non-operated working interest in the deepwater producing Baobab field offshore Cote d’Ivoire. This acquisition greatly expands VAALCO's presence in West Africa, adding significant 1P and 2P reserves and enabling a long-term production runway through planned upgrades and drilling campaigns. VAALCO also gains an interest in the Uge discovery in Nigeria alongside major partners like ExxonMobil and Chevron.

articles.title: Shale Patch M&A Might Be Booming, But Refineries Are Left Behind
articles.summary: The shale patch is experiencing a significant M&A boom with over $250 billion in deals in 2023, driven by a scramble for low-cost oilfields. However, the U.S. refining industry is conspicuously missing from this boom, facing dire conditions with refinery closures, failed sales, and high maintenance costs for aging plants. Despite challenges, the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) forecasts a substantial increase in global liquid fuels demand by 2050.

articles.title: CrossAmerica Partners to Acquire 59 Convenience Stores From Applegreen for $16.9 Million
articles.summary: CrossAmerica Partners LP is set to acquire 59 convenience stores from Applegreen Midwest and Applegreen Florida for $16.9 million. This acquisition, which includes c-stores in Michigan, Minnesota, Wisconsin, and Florida, involves the termination of existing lease agreements and the purchase of inventory. Applegreen is reportedly shifting its focus to expanding its presence in the U.S. travel plaza sector.

articles.title: Suriname oil discovery in focus as operator axes remaining acreage
articles.summary: APA Corporation is focusing on further exploration and appraisal work around its Block 53 oil discovery in Suriname. This comes as the operator has decided to abandon its remaining acreage in the region. The article highlights the company's strategic shift towards optimizing its existing discovery.

articles.title: Sempra Looking Beyond LNG Pause to ‘Development Milestones’ for Port Arthur, Cameron Expansions
articles.summary: Sempra Infrastructure is focusing on development milestones and partnerships for its LNG projects, including Port Arthur LNG and Cameron LNG expansions, despite the Biden administration's pause on new export authorizations. The company anticipates an FID for Cameron LNG's fourth train by July 2025 and expects to complete its Gasoducto Rosarito pipeline project in Mexico by year-end. Sempra reported increased full-year natural gas revenue for 2023 and outlined significant capital expenditures for infrastructure investments over the next five years.
